intro: Carduus arenarius, commonly known as the desert thistle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and a distinctive yellow flower head that blooms in late summer. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its growth habit is typically upright, with a compact form that helps reduce water loss. The seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas in disturbed or barren environments.
